title: Girls Who Code Orlando 2016, Session A
subtitle: Camp 1 Class Agenda
address: Melrose Center at the Orlando Public Library, 101 E. Central Blvd. Orlando, FL 32801
description: In response to the need to redefine the conversation with our girls regarding futures in technology and science, weVENTURE powered by the Florida Institute of Technology is launching the national program Girls Who Code in Orlando to shift the landscape of technology.

sessions.title: Welcome Breakfast
sessions.description: Welcome everyone to Girls Who Code. Socialize, eat bagels, drink juice, and be friendly. Volunteer Introductions.

sessions.title: Student Survey
sessions.description: Girls Who Code pre-course research survey.

sessions.title: Class Icebreaker, Student Introductions
sessions.description: Getting to know you through paper airplanes.

sessions.title: Course Intro
sessions.description: What is Computer Science? What is Girls Who Code?

sessions.title: Teaching a Robot to make PB&J
sessions.description: Holly Akers teaches how to write instructions (programs) that computers can follow.

sessions.title: BREAK
sessions.description: Brief relief for body and mind

sessions.title: Canvas & Codesters Setup
sessions.description: Students get setup on Canvas and Codesters platforms. Take attendance.

sessions.title: Placement Test
sessions.description: Students take course placement test.

sessions.title: Intro to Programming
sessions.description: Getting Started. Code Together.

sessions.title: Codesters Intro
sessions.description: Codesters Lesson 1

sessions.title: Problem Solving
sessions.description: How to break down problems and find solutions (yellow wall 2-3pm)

sessions.description: How to break down problems and find solutions (yellow wall 2-3pm)

sessions.title: Melrose Tour
sessions.description: Show the students the amazing technical resources available to them at the library

sessions.title: Class Closing
sessions.description: Expectations for tomorrow & Closing Icebreaker

sessions.title: Free Time
sessions.description: Girls can socialize, browse the web, work on projects, whatever they like, until we get kicked out.
